Cookie Policy

How we use cookies and local storage to improve your experience.

Last updated: October 28, 2025

1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files placed on your device (computer, phone, or tablet) when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work, or work more efficiently, as well as to provide information to the site owners.

In this policy, the term "cookies" also refers to similar technologies like **`localStorage`** and **`sessionStorage`**, which our Service uses to store information on your device.

2. How We Use Cookies

Trace'N Find uses cookies and local storage for essential function and performance. We do not use third-party marketing or advertising cookies.

Our uses are categorized as follows:

A. Strictly Necessary (Essential)

These are required for the operation of our Service. They include, for example, the storage of your authentication session, which allows you to log in and remain logged in to the secure areas of our app.

  • **Firebase Authentication:** We use `localStorage` to store your Firebase authentication token (authToken). This is what keeps you logged in as you navigate between pages in the secure app. If you disable this, you will not be able to log in.
  • **Session Persistence:** When you check "Remember Me" on the login page, we use `browserLocalPersistence` (via Firebase) to keep you logged in even after you close your browser.

B. Functional (Preferences)

These are used to recognize you when you return to our website and to remember your preferences. This enables us to personalize your experience.

  • **Theme Preference:** We use `localStorage` to store your preferred theme (theme: 'dark' or theme: 'light'). This ensures the site loads with your chosen theme on your next visit.
  • **Sidebar Preference:** For the app dashboard, we use `localStorage` to remember if you left the sidebar open or minimized.

C. Analytical (Performance)

As part of our Firebase integration, we may use Google's Measurement ID (`measurementId`) to collect anonymous analytics about how you interact with our Service. This helps us understand which features are popular, identify bugs, and improve the overall performance and **scalability** of the application. This data is anonymized and is not linked to your PII.

3. Your Choices

Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies. However, please be aware that blocking the **Strictly Necessary** cookies (like your Firebase authentication token) will make it impossible to use the secure, logged-in portions of our Service.

You can clear your browser's `localStorage` at any time to remove your theme preference and saved login session.

4. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy, please contact us:

  • By email: privacy@trace-n-find.com
  • By visiting our Contact Page.
